instruction:
Position Locating (Written)

You are about to begin the "Position Locating" test. At the beginning, you will see a map comprising the majority of the screen. This map will be used to answer the simulated calls that are displayed on the right-hand side of the screen. The simulated calls will describe certain items that appear on the map. Using the information provided, you are to determine the most-likely location of the caller on the map.

The map is divided into a grid by columns and rows. Use the two drop down boxes to select the appropriate answer. In the first drop down box, select a letter relating to a column on the map. In the second drop down box you will select a number relating the a row on the map. The intersection of the column and row is what you consider to be the most-likely location of the caller.

Once you have selected a column and a row from the drop down boxes, you can proceed to the next question using the "Next" button. If you wish to review previous questions use the "Back" button. You can also skip an unanswered question by clicking the "Next" button. You may return to unanswered questions later in the test.

If a time limit has been set for this test by the test administrator, you will see the timer counting down in the bottom right-hand corner of the screen. This timer shows how much time you have remaining to complete the test. If no time limit has been set, there will be no visible timer.

Across the top of the screen you will see a toolbar. This toolbar lists the total number of questions and the number of unanswered questions remaining. It also contains a drop down list of all unanswered questions. You can use this list to quickly navigate to any unanswered question. This toolbar also contains the "Done" button.

When you have finished the test, you can click the "Done" button in the top toolbar or you can simply click the "Next" button below the drop down boxes one final time.

questions.questionText: There is a suspicious looking person walking around this area. I am in the middle of the street and I can see the hospital directly in front of me. I can also see a 2-story building with a billboard on top of it behind me.
I want to report a traffic accident that has just occurred. I am in the middle of the street in between a communication tower and a park. I can see a 5-story building past the park.
There is a child left in a car nearby. I just left a 4-story building and can see the fire station in front of me.

I want to report a fight breaking out nearby. I am in the middle of the street and I can see a communication tower next to 2, 10-story buildings. Looking between the 2 buildings I can also see the fire station.
I want to report a person yelling loudly in the streets. I just exited a 4-story building and in front of me is the University.
I’m completely lost and have no idea where I am. Behind me a river and directly in front of me is a 2-story building.
I want to report a mattress in the middle of the road but I’m not familiar with this area. I can see a communication tower in front of me, a park to the left, and a hospital to the right.
My car was broken into and I’m in a part of town I’m not familiar with. I am facing a 2-story building. There is a billboard behind me and a power line to the right.
I was with my mom but we got separated. I’m in a single story building. Looking out the window I can see a billboard on the same block. I can also see a river behind the billboard.
My mom hit her head and isn’t moving. We are on the top floor of a 7-story building and I can see the university outside the window.
My mom passed out and won’t wake up. We are on the top floor of a 6-story building next to a park and I can see a 10-story building out of the window.
I got separated from my parents and don’t know where they are. I am on the roof of the hospital and right in front of me is a billboard. I can see the river to my left.
I want to report a car driving the wrong way down a street. I am at the south end of a park. There is a communication tower to the east.
A black car was speeding and ran a red light. I am in the middle of the intersection of 2nd St. and E St.
I just saw the wind blow a trash can through a window. I am in facing the police station and directly to my left are some power lines.
